Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie O
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at Hostal Persal twice, most recently in August 2012. Each time it has been fantastic! I was originally booked elsewhere and when that turned out to be less than expected I immediately switched to Hostal Persal. The location is in the center of everything, 2 minute walk south from Puerta del Sol, 5 minute walk from Plaza Mayor, San Miguel Mercado, and Cava Baja (great tapas street), and 10-15 minute walk from Retiro Park. The room was great! All bathroom necessities were provided. Bed was more than adequate and most important the room has AIR CONDITIONING, which was very necessary this summer as it was 105 degrees when I was there. Wifi works in the rooms for free and everything was very clean. We requested a balcony room and got it with no extra charge. The view of Plaza Angel was beautiful. Felix at the front desk is very helpful and nice. Breakfast is included and simple, just toast, cereal, and yogurt. But just the free coffee and tea was great as I would have gone and paid a couple euro elsewhere for it in the mornings. This is the best hostal I have ever found and it should be noted it is really a hotel as it lacks nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sorhol
Reviews.Content: Perfect spot close to Plaza Santa Ana with lots of restaurants and action. Placed on a nice litte square with the coolest Jazz bar (Cafe Central) Extremely friendly, nice clean rooms and an OK breakfast. But it is really all about location. I will definately stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great rate, and very kind staff”
Reviews.Author: Manicrobot
Reviews.Content: So getting here wasn't a problem considering it's location is at the heart of the city. Taking the 24 hour bus that runs from the airport to the Banco de Espana, and from there taking the underground metro to Sol making it a smooth transition. The hostal had small rooms, but they were enough and pretty up to date. The staff was very kind, we would ask about certain things about the city, and they would be very helpful. The only thing I can think that was a little issue, but not anything that cause frustration. The WiFi was somewhat difficult to get in the room, but yet again we were at the very top of the building. Going down to the lounge area would get you a better connection. Great stay, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: zimchicktravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Madrid. I wanted to see as much of the city as I could on my short trip to Madrid. The staff at the hotel offered me a map of the city and marked for me an easy route that took me through 10 "not to miss" places in Madrid scattered around the city. The hotel is very central which made it easy to walk everywhere. The hotel rooms though small are clean. Breakfast is good. Although surrounded by busy restuarants the rooms are quiet, I may have been lucky I was in a room facing the alley.The wireless internet is fast.I would highly recommend this hotel. Its great value for money and the staff are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great time!”
Reviews.Author: TwoUKtravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just had a great four night stay at this hostal. It was recommended to us by our daughter who had stayed there twice before. The location is brilliant, and we walked to all the main sights from the hostel. There are so many great little bars and restaurants nearby in that area that we were spoiled for choice. All the Hostal staff we came into contact with were welcoming, friendly and helpful. Check-in was quick and easy and we were shown up to our room. The room was clean and functional, with everything we needed for our stay, including a good hairdryer. Our room was on the third floor at the front and we had a small balcony, just big enough for the two of us to stand on - I would definitely recommend a room at the front. The room was not noisy, even though there were pavement cafes below as, if you wanted to, you could close the shutters and the outer and inner doors. The room was air conditioned so was always cool. Breakfast was included and taken in a very pleasant room with large communal or small tables. It was simple, but filling, with a selection of cereals, ham, cheese, pastries etc. The breakfast waiter was always friendly and chatty and kept the buffet well filled. As has been said previously, the timings of 7.30am to 11am fit well with the Madrid late nights! Our flight was not until the evening of the final day of our stay, and we were able to store our luggage in a secure room to collect later in the day. We would recommend the Hostal Persal as a simple, clean great value for money place to stay in a very central location in Madrid. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: asteele3
Reviews.Content: Great Hostal. The reason it isn't a Hotel is because it hasn't got a few facilities that a hotel might have like a bar etc... but as there are bars right outside the door, this doesn't really matter and is one of the main reasons why I'm giving it 5/5 stars! I stayed in Madrid from Saturday - Wednesday morning and it is a great little hostal with happy and helpful staff. You can even leave your luggage there on book out date if you're planning to see some last sights of Madrid before heading home. Breakfast is nice and simple. A choice of cornflakes, coco pops and museli plus the pastry section of Croissants, bread, ham and toast etc... Orange juice and apple juice were also on the menu. It's open from 7:30am - 11am which comes in really handy if you've had a late night the day before! Around the Hostal are lots of bars and restaurants near by with a few newsagents and a bakery. Overall, it's situated in a great location and the views from the balcony are fantastic! If you're looking for a place to stay in the centre of Madrid but don't want to spend much, then this hostal is definately for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ruby1885
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister and friend (girls trip). We had reserved a triple and were given a room that had two small rooms with two beds each plus one bathroom. We had plenty of space. Plus we had two small balcony's that looked out over the plaza. This hotel is not fancy but really great for the price. Beds were decent, everything was very clean. Check in and check out was quick. The elevator here was very small but worked fine. The breakfast was decent with a good variety of breads, jams, yogurt, drinks, etc... This was out last stop on our trip and we really enjoyed it. I would stay here again when visiting madrid. We were in room 323. We also tried the restaurant downstairs, Ginger, for the menu of the day. About 10 euros for a starter, main entree, wine and desert. A great price for good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, in a great location! ”
Reviews.Author: Nina V
Reviews.Content: Me and my other half had the pleasure of staying at this hotel, during a short weekend break! As this was our first visit to Madrid, I was pleasantly surprised to find Hostal Persal located in a typical Madrid square, close to main points of interest! As we only stayed 2 nights, we weren't too fussed that our room was on a tiny side & we had a rather miserable view of a very small courtyard. The bathroom was surprisingly nice & spacious, everything was perfectly clean! I so wished we had a room at the front side of the hotel, then I would have given this visit the full 5 stars! However, the hotel was full capacity at the time of our visit... During our stay, we also had breakfast, which was a bit basic, but taking into account the price of it, completely reasonable. All the hotel staff, we're really nice & helpful. All in all, this place is definitely a great value for money and if you want to experience the real Madrid, Hostal Persal has it right on its doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Stay”
Reviews.Author: aceswild1415
Reviews.Content: my husband has been very loyal to this place for years now :-) and when u say madrid in my family , we dont look for any other place but Hostal Persal. Apart from the great location, it has the most helpful and friendly staff :-), not mention value for your money.. everything was perfect, only i think their elevator had some small problem during our stay, before going to ground level (0) it will go to lower ground (-1) first before it will go back to ground level. Also we were very happy to get a room with a balcony fronting the plaza.... that was really something...Apart from the elevator mishap.. everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barterboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hostal Persal in May and were extremely pleased with both the location and standard of this Hotel. The room and bathroom was very clean and well appointed - with better lighting and a view from the window I would rate at 100%! It suited us though as we did not want to spend a lot of time in a room - there is so much to see in Madrid and we were so conveniently placed to get to many places. 5 min stroll in one direction to Plaza Mayor and the same to Puerta del Sol another way. Atocha railway station about 20 mins in another direction. Staff at Hostal Persal very polite and helpful and the breakfast buffet was also very good. If you want luxury this might not be for you but if you want good value, clean accommodation in a superb location in Madrid then I can't see that you will be disappointed! Would not hesitate to reccommend and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and excellent service in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: nightship538
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hostal Persal two different times for a total of four during my recent trip to Spain. I found the Persal very much to my liking, both in terms of location (a 5-min walk from Puerta del Sol, convenient to the metro), and the rooms, which were spare but clean and comfortable. The first room I stayed in was a bit small, but had a decent bathroom for its size. The second room overlooked the Plaza del Angel, and was very large for a double-- but the bathroom was very small, just a bit larger than its shower stall. I didn't mind, as the Hostal had so much charm and the staff was extremely nice and most helpful. The breakfast was very good, with a selection of breads, cereals, meats, and jams. As has been noted, the coffee is excellent-- have another cup! I also dined one night at the Ginger Restaurant, located in the hotel building. The food was outstanding at a moderate price. A very pleasant surprise. I would not hesitate to recommend the Persal as a convenient, charming, and friendly lodging place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the name”
Reviews.Author: ITQ
Reviews.Content: A two star hostel with everything you need: PERFECT location, friendly staff, clean rooms (OK, small, no frills...), nice breakfast, great restaurants at the doorstep... We were not sure about it; mixed reviews, some terrible photos, but decided to give it a try. Best decision ever. I am going to make it my official accomodation in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Not too different from a cruise ship room.”
Reviews.Author: JakenNC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights in early April 2012. I found it originally from a recommendation in Frommers Madrid book. I was a little aprehensive after reading the reviews here, but decided based on the price and location to stay in HP. I was going to stay at the Marriott AC Carlson until the last minute, I canceled that reservation and kept the one for Hostal Persal. Best decision I ever made! Hostal Persal is so close to so many interesting things. We walked every where. There are a "thousand" restaurants - mostly small with little bars and a lot of character -- in the surrounding alley like streets. Plus Plaza de Santa Ana is about 50 yards away and it has more restaurants. Plaza del Sol is a 5 minute walk. We took the Metro from the Airport to Plaza del Sol and dragged our luggage to the hotel and it was no problem. As for the hotel...Lobby is nice. Staff is very friendly as is almost everyone we met in the service industry in Madrid. Rooms: small but clean. Bathroooms: Small but not too small and perfectly clean and they look on the newer side. Soft towels and super hard water pressure in the shower. We never had any problem sleeping due to noise, but we live close to the freeway in Metro DC so it might be quieter in this hotel than home. We had a room that faced the Plaza and it was great to be able to open the balcony doors and look out onto the Plaza and see people walking around and the view is nice at night. We felt very safe there and were out a few times til 2am. Not much closet or drawer space but enough if you wont be there forever. plenty of room under the beds to store whatever. Wi-Fi was good, not great, but we definitely stayed connected with a laptop, an iPad, and an iPhone online at the same time. Made some audio onlySkype calls that dropped eventually. iPhone Facetime was not smooth, but audio part was fine. There is a little grocery/fruit stand next door that we went to constantly for water, Coke, fruit, and snacks...all priced reasonably. Got bananas and strawberries that were better than any strawberries I have seen in a US supermarket. And for trips out of Madrid, if you want to go to Toledo, the Atocha Train station is about a 15 minute walk away. While it doesnt have the ammenties of a cruise ship, if you can stay in a cruise ship room, you will be more than fine in a room in this hostal. We had a double bed and a single bed for the three of us. The only drawback for me was that the double bed was not real comfortable and was a little bit tight for the two of us on it. But the price was the best for a room accomodating three people I could find in Old Madrid. In the past two years I have stayed in hotels that were alot more expensive in Paris, Venice, and Barcelona, and this was better or equal to any of those. Even though we spent a night in the Westin Palace (5 star) and another night by the Airport in Hotel Axor Barajas (4 star), we were very happy with our stay in Hostal Persal. I will say we only spent time in our room to sleep and shower. If you are in to the whole "hotel experience" you might not like this. But if you need a great base of operation for being out and about in Madrid...this is an excellent choice. Even when we went to Westin Palace we still just slept there. We checked in and immediately spent the rest of the day and evening out in Madrid...so that was a lot to pay for a bed and shower. Staff is a superb.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, but no more.”
Reviews.Author: flightwithadutchman
Reviews.Content: Mind you, the hotel has its qualities: location in the centre of Madrid being foremost, friendly staff is another one. But the walls seem to be made of paper: you'll hear every flea 5 rooms down the corridor. In addition, the rooms are tiny (but clean) and the wifi was distinctly "so so" last time around. I stayed there several times in the past but I'll look for an alternative if the purpose is business travel. If you're out for a night on the town, by all means stay here. Whatever your last watering hole may be, you should be able to get here without too much hassle. And all the entertainment is smack around you.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything...”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: In a perfect position to peruse the restaurants and shops, a short walk to the gallery and a bus to other attractions. Room had a massive bed and double doors to stop the noise...very thin walls though but all hotels do. Reception staff accommodating, breakfast basic and a beautiful foyer area. A lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Floridagirl066
Reviews.Content: The location, service and breakfast are excellent. However, the room itself is terribly basic. There are NO frills, although the bathroom is nicely appointed with mirror, blow dryer and shampoo, etc. If you are just looking for a place to crash, this is fine. If you are looking for a place to spend a little time, I would suggest that you keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: foryourinterest562
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple nights around New Year's here. Noisey when the bars let out with drunks kicking cans down the streets and drug deals going down right out the front door. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quite adequate. The front desk and breakfast staff were pleasant and eager to help. Our room was kept very tidy and well stocked. There were 4 of us in the room and the 4 twin beds fit us fine. We had to keep our luggage on the floor and the only place to sit was the bed. We did have one cafe table but no chairs. Still, 4 twins was important to us and they were supplied perfectly. The room did not smell of smoke (this can be rare in Spain) Sometimes it will come floating through from other places but not in the room. We were in the front of the hotel and it was noisey for about one hour around 3:00am when the bars close and the trash truck collects the garbage placed right in front of the hotel from all the business in the vacinity. The local streets generally have little car traffic. The hotel was convenient to Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor as well as an easy walk to local attractions (though not super-close) But, remember, this is a walking city, so "close-by" has a different meaning depending where you come from and how you live. Despite the "deals going down outside..it still felt safe to walk around. There are pick pockets around, so keep your valuables safely stored. There are lots of peop;e walking around the streets and the safety we felt was from the numbers of people out and about and the vibrancy of this neighborhood. The hotel is next door to a cute little late-night grocery and many other retail spots. NOW the BEST PART...for a continental breakfast...the food was delicious, the coffe perfect and the nicest "morning" staff. Lots of yummy sweets and breads, cheeses, cereals, yogurt and fruits. I believe they have a restaurant next to the lobby that appears to be upscale but we did not eat there. If they sold churros we might have never left. The price across the holiday weekend was reasonable. GIVE IT A LOOK

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option in an excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: ahydarg
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid last August for a couple of days and I really enjoyed my stay at Hostal Persal. It has a GREAT location in Barrio de Las Letras, you can find lots of restaurants & bars around and walk to all the famous places in Madrid (Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, Puerta de Alcala, Parque el Retiro, Museo del Prado). Bedrooms are very nice and clean. Price is good and include breakfast!!! It is an excellent option to enjoy Madrid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Plavec_H
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, not too pricey. GREAT and friendly service and even better complimentary breakfast buffet! Wonderful location being right next to Sol. Many great bars and restaurants around. Rooms cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: andirincon
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hostal Persal, and really don't understand why it is considered a hostal at all! Room was very clean, staff was very helpful to english speaking guests, and free breakfast in the morning...can't beat it! We were easy walking distance from all the big sites, very easy to get around! Great value for the heart of Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: phishlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Persal for a week. The front desk was multilingual, genial and cooperative. The rooms were clean and spartan. No fridge, nice shower in small bath. Safe. A closet with a few drawers. A desk and a small wall mounted TV. Mostly, you live out of your suitcase. So, if you want a luxious room in Madrid, pass this by. We spent $800 and change for the week which included a nice continental breakfast in the near absolute center of the city, walking everywhere so it suited us perfectly. Some of the reviewers mentioned noise. The Persal is located on the Plaza del Angel. Madrid is a nocturnal city, even more than we expected. We fronted on the Plaza, Room 118. Admittedly there was noise from those going home at 2 or 3 in the morning. One night there was a special event in the Persal and we were serenaded by the departing guests. (That night even the noise in the lobby was loud.) We are active "young" seniors. If the noise bothers you, you can buy a set of earplugs at the pharmacy up the street. Or, you can stay in one of the rooms off the front of the hotel. If you want the pulse and feeling of a great city I suggest you tough it out. There is dining outside in the Plaza and one night it was filled with various music acts. In sum, did we use the earplugs? Sometimes, yes. But most of the time we just reveled in the sounds of living. If you don't feel like walking then you can catch a cab at the end of the block. There is very limited vehicle access in the Plaza. It is a short walk from the Persal to a number of Metro stations. We took the shuttle bus in from Barajas airport to Atocha Station, a great bargain, and hopped the subway and were pointed in the right direction when we reached our stop on the Metro. In the evening we shopped at a local grocery for some excellent and inexpensive wine and the staff at Persal graciously provided nice wine glasses for our purchases. Our happy hour was cheap, flavorful and a delight. If anyone reading this has ever stayed at Sully St. Germain in Paris, the Persal is very similar. As I said then and say now, we don't go traveling for luxourious accommodations. We want value, cleanliness and convenince and Persal provided them all for us. I would stay there again. Oh, and next door, adjoining Persal with just a fire door between, is Ginger, a good restaurant which was packed every night. One night we were just too beat to go around town and had a very nice meal there at a very reasonable price. I would go there again as well.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: critic45_10
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Hostal Persal for 5 nights in late October. We can both say we found the Hostal ideal for a stay in Madrid. Our room was clean and bright. The staff friendly and helpful. The Breakfast in a lovely atmospheric room a delightful surprise especially for the price. The location of the Hostal in Madrid is excellent. The hostal is situated in a small square and very centrally for all the sights in the city. Lovely Tapas bars nearby. Wi-Fi connection in our bedroom was useful as we could Skype friends and relatives at home and also look up opening times and costs of Museums and Galleries.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: manchester1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, breakfast included in price, friendly staff, spotless hotel but basic and dated, can't complain for the price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SebastianWestCountry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Persal on our return to Madrid from Andalusia. We had stopped in Madrid on our way south in a 4+ star hotel which was a great disappointment. We were determined not to stay there on our way back, but had some misgivings after we had booked Hostal Persal (although we had seen it on our way south). Persal is exactly what it claims to be, viz a budget hotel that tries to maintain standards. Luxurious it is not, but the rooms although basic are very adequately furnished and the bathroom was spotlessly clean with good quality towels (we found the latter were an exception rather than the rule in Spain including in 5 star hotels). The breakfast was very adequate and the staff replenished the buffet table and cleared the tables very promptly. The staff were very pleasant with one exception. When we checked out I asked for my credit card to be debited in euros and this seemed to upset the check-out clerk. He was positively unpleasant which was odd since all the other staff were very pleasant indeed. Of course the location is perfect for visits to the galleries and the more interesting parts of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Triz012
Reviews.Content: After having visited it many times, i can say that employees are nice, the place is clean, the location is perfect. From barajas airport is just one change: get to nuevos ministerios with line 8, chang from that metro company to the other and go to puera del sol. From there walk along calle espoz y medina. The hostal is at the end of this short street. The 1st floor is rumorous, the rest are ok. Free wi-fi, average breakfast. Full of fun places to hang out near at the door of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic accommodations in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth7887
Reviews.Content: We recently booked 1 night at Hostal Persal due to ratings read here and on another site. The Hostal is located in the perfect location - adjacent to the lovely Plaza Santa Ana, in a lively quaint square of its own. From the outside it looks lovely, the lobby is modern and clean, the staff is exceptional. We were not expecting to find such a basic accommodation once we got up to the room, reminiscent of a college dorm or, frankly, a hostel. As this place is rated 2 stars, we expected a little more than what we found. The room was clean however, and I think we would've enjoyed our stay more if our room was overlooking the plaza, rather than facing a dark interior courtyard. As long as you know what you're expecting, you'll enjoy your stay and for someone looking for inexpensive accommodation in the center of the action with a warm, English speaking staff, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: jonw67
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a last minute deal and must say that we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The room was spotlessly clean with modern decor and a free safety deposit box was most welcome. The room was smaller than average which was probably down to the age and layout of the building. However, this did not affect our experience as we spent most of our time exploring Madrid. The location could not have been better, only minutes away from Plaza Mayor and not much further to the Prado gallery and the beautiful Parque de Retiro. We highly recommend the Hostal Persal.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodation right in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BonzoD
Reviews.Content: Hostal Persal was a real find given we had absolutely no idea where to stay in Madrid beforehand. Friendly and helpful staff, smallish but clean rooms, reasonable cost (continental breakfast included), and most importantly convenient location helped make our visit to the Spanish capital our most enjoyable of the trip so far. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcia33
Reviews.Content: Hostal Persal was a clean hotel located on a busy plaza in Madrid. We stayed as a family and the hotel staff was very accomodating. The staff was concerned that the hotel met our needs and were helpful in arranging cab service to the airport early on Sunday morning. They try to keep the hotel smoke free but some guests do not respect this rule. If you want to go to sleep early, there is noise from the plaza. If you want to enjoy the night life of Madrid, this will not affect your stay. The hotel is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: VeraBF
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, friendly staff and a very good restaurant. Don’t expect luxury, but has everything you need for a clean stay. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Xerys
Reviews.Content: While this hostel is not the last word in luxury it does exactly that what it says on the label. In fact, it should rather be called Hotel as opposed to Hostel. This is in fact more of a 2-star hotel and I really cannot classify this as a hostel. This was the third or the fourth time I stayed here and every time teh experience was the same. The check-in is swift, efficient and friendly. The staff is very knowledgable about what goes on in the area and speak English. The rooms are somewhat small and dark though but as you are surely not spending too much time here it should not be too much of an issue. Said rooms are equipped with direct dial telephones and a TV's with a selection of channels in European and English. A laundry facility is available but not same-day over weekends. An internet desk is available. Breakfast is ALWAYS the same every day - orange or pineapple juice with a selection of coffees, some danish pastries, sliced cheese and ham and small hard rolls. While not the typical breakfasts used to when coming from my neck of the woods, I surely never went hungry. The location is in fact perfect and close enough to the main attractions, but you don't need to even walk that far to find a cafe or pub. Just to the left of the hostel is a pub in which there are regular live performers making music and the cafe's spill out onto the square right in front of the hostel. Just down the road and turn left into the main road and another big square (in front of Sol underground) and you're near the Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. Other fantastic sights include the Sabatini Gardens and Retiro Park which are a little further away. A one-way taxi ride to the airport set me back around EUR35.00. If you don't have 5 star expectations, Hostel Persal should fulfill your expectations and more!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: GisellaMeneguelli
Reviews.Content: The reception is excellent, the coffee break is good and the location is perfect. I recomend this hostal, because the price is very good and the services too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hostal, excellent location, friendly front desk”
Reviews.Author: localboy66
Reviews.Content: We happened to pass by this hostal exploring Madrid for the first time, & glad we did. It's great appealing appearance caught our attention as we went past on Plaza de Angel. I stopped in and inquired rates & ammenities which were what we wanted. We asked to see a room & it was squeaky clean & nice. So we checked out of our current hostal early & stayed here the last night in Madrid to give it a try. We were glad we did. It was a great experience. The front desk person Ricardo went out of his way to accomodate us & was always smiling when we saw him. I liked the air conditioned lobby with wide "automatic" opening front door. The room also had great central air conditioning & double pane windows making it quiet (we were on 2nd floor facing the plaza. The elevator was small but adequet . We had a continental breakfast included which was excellent . Can't say much for the dining room attendant though. He wasnt interested in giving you the time of day, much less a simple smile. Just abruptly asked for your room number. Location hard to beat, close to Sol, Mayor, Santa Ana, & more. You can walk to Atocha train station, Prado in 15-20 minutes. This is where we'll stay when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SariPoage
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this hotel. We had a great stay and the staff was fairly helpful. Only downside wasthe wifi didn't work in our room so we had to stand in the hallway or go to the lobby if we wanted to use it. We stayed on the fourth floor which is a new addition and apparently has better room than the other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced gem, lovely staff, fab location”
Reviews.Author: CaTyLondon
Reviews.Content: The Hostal Persal represents value for money, good service and all in a location bang in the centre of Madrid. The rooms are basic - but comfortable and spotless, the breakfast is fine, and the staff are charming. The only fault I can find is that, when we asked for a restaurant recommendation, we were sent to a (very average) paella restaurant 10 mins walk away. We subsequently, and accidentally, had a superb lunch, great food and great value, in the Ginger restaurant attached to the hotel! No need to walk to average paella at all!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: CdnTraveller56079
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Close to many of the major sites in Madrid. The staff is friendly. The breakfast is fine. The rooms are clean and adequate for our purposes and the price was right. Only real problem, the free WIFI was not good. It was very slow and we got dropped frequently. It seemed to depend on where we were in the room. It got so frustrating that we gave up most of the time. They do have a computer for use in the lobby and it costs 1 euro for 15 minutes. It was quite warm when we were there in April 2011. Temperatures of 25-28 degrees, however they said that they don't turn the air conditioning on until June. We were fairly comfotable at night by opening our window, but it can get noisy outside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great staff, good price”
Reviews.Author: Radamandlisa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were delighted to find this hotel. It's a hostel it's basic and no frills, but the room was clean, and the staff were sooo friendly. They even helped me with my Spanish. The location is in the centre of everything and we walked to all the sights, plazas, and museums. We would certainly stay here again next time we come to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic breakfast, average rooms but cheap”
Reviews.Author: ryancropp
Reviews.Content: Hostal Persal is in a great location, but it's pretty let down by the run-down state of the rooms. The rooms are fairly small and the style is outdated, however they are clean. Our bed was small but not uncomfortable. We had little success with the free wi-fi, which only seemed to work on the ground level in the lobby. The breakfast is basic but sufficient. The staff are friendly and helpful. We got a pretty good deal with the price, so it was worth it despite the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “iDEAL LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF.”
Reviews.Author: johnnybarcelona
Reviews.Content: Says it all in the title, from arrival to departure, we felt welcomed. The room was basic, but quiet and comfortable. The location is ideal and easy to find..Calle Huertas leads straight to the Prado/Retiro..or turn left for Plaza Mayor in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lanzaroteowl
Reviews.Content: Right in the center,friendly staff and cheap rates,what more could you want

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: silkcashmere
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and certainly were not disappointed. The location is central (in Sol) and on the main precinct. The rooms are small but well kept and ours faced onto a central (but closed) courtyard. Facilities are limited- no in room iron available etc.. but otherwise great value for money and secure in a central location. The metro is close by and so are the central shopping and sightseeing districts. (Hotel also has free wifi)

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: UkMb1
Reviews.Content: Having used Trip Advisor in our search for accomodation throughout Europe I thought it time to repay the compliment. We booked this 2* hostal on the recommendation of previous reviewers and it did not disappoint. Firstly ignore the word hostal, it does not have the same meaning as in the UK. This "hostal " is a gem. Situated close to Sol on a fairly quiet pedestrian street. (Took earplugs but did not need them) due to the excellent double glazing. We had room 413, a twin bedded room with balcony, great for people watching. The beds were firm and the bed linen fresh and super clean. In fact what struck me most was the cleanliness of the whole place. Although the sleeping area was compact the total floor space with hall and bathroom was quite large. A room safe was provided free of charge and TV news channel in English. Breakfast was included in the price approx 235 euros for 3 nights. Cereal, fruit salad, bread, cheese, ham and pastries. Again super clean, the cutlery positively gleamed. Some reviewers mention the lift. Yes, it is small, but in my opinion quite charming. Enough room for two people with a small amount of luggage. If you are on the 4th flr there are some stairs as well, so perhaps not suited to the less mobile. The hotel has a restaurant to the side and a small bar. Neither of which we frequented, but the restaurant seemed quite busy and the prices reasonable. Directly outside are cafes and to the right of them the Plaza St. Ana, with more cafes. Don't miss the covered market San Miguel off the Plaza Mayor. Take some tapas and wine, perch on the stools and breath in the atmosphere. Make time to visit Toledo, 30 mins by train from Atocha railway station. There are tour buses waiting to meet you. A 2hr tour with guide and entrance to the Cathederal cost 20 euros pp. The Cathederal is beautiful. We used the metro in the daytime from the airport and found it to be inexpensive, efficient and the staff were helpful with directions. All in all a great city break.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid central hotel - clean with great service, value, food and price.”
Reviews.Author: Lei_traveller
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I spent hours trying to find a hotel that was centrally located under £100 per night for a twin room. We nearly gave up when we came across Hotel Persal in Plaza Angel. 1960's Spanish retro decor & neither grand nor splendid but if you are looking for very friendly service with basic bed and breakfast, then this is perfect. There is a restaurant attached which is part of a small chain - very reasonably priced and good wine list and fabulous 1920's-esque decor. After reading lots of very grumpy reviews on here about all sorts of different types of accommodation in Madrid, we were enlightened to find this place. Should we ever go back to Madrid, this will be where we stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good enough and location great”
Reviews.Author: Willjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group at the tail end of 2009 and agree with some of the comments made here about the size of the rooms. However for the money it was absolutely fine and in a great location. I would recommend the wee bar near the hotel in particular, the Espana Cani I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, poor standard for the price”
Reviews.Author: oldfolk15
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks good downstairs. Rooms poor and bathrooms tiny you have to shuffle to get in to them. The rooms were clean but poorly furnished. Tiles on bathroom floor and walls cracked. Restaurant good value. The location was excellent central to everything. The upper floors of the hotel need to be refurbished. Reception staff helpful. The rooms need to be checked to see what is working and what is not. Very basic for the price

Reviews.Title: “good location and really normal breakfast”
Reviews.Author: signes
Reviews.Content: bad things - there wasnt enough air in the room, it was small. we had a really small window. the room air conditioning didnt work. the internet was really really slow. good things- breakfast and location and cleaning lady, she cleaned our room every day! ok - staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gloskeith
Reviews.Content: This is a budget-priced hotel, so I wasn't surprised to be allocated the smallest of rooms. However, it had what I wanted - a good bed, a perfectly adequate bathroom, a TV with access to the BBC. It also had the bonus of wi-fi access, which was extremely useful. But the room was the only thing that reflected the budget status of the hotel. This was a hotel that obviously took a pride in itself. It was very clean and the entrance lobby was even quite classy. I stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and the breakfast was excellent and was eaten in a pleasant, large dining room on the ground floor. The location of the hotel was perfect - just a short walk to the Puerta del Sol and to two Metro stations (Sol and Tirso de Molina). However, one of the most pleasing aspects of staying at the Persal was the friendliness of the staff. All of them were charming and helpful. Next time I am in Madrid I will certainly make a point of returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price, overall OK”
Reviews.Author: IrishManinNicaragua
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean, good price, breakfast was fine, staff efficient, good shower. Some negatives- small rooms, can be noisy, poor quality bed, tv didn't work properly, aircon didn't seem to work. However, overall, good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel at the best location”
Reviews.Author: Shmulikmen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just on the "Piatza Del angel" which is in the center of Madrid The staff are nice freindly and very helpfull, each recomendation they gave us was great. The room is small but very clean with AC and bath. Breakfast is included but it's same every day and very basic Bottom line it's a great place to stay for exploring Madrid. We loved it

Reviews.Title: “great location but”
Reviews.Author: JoyceinNY
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very spartan, no furniture and just 2 small lamps above the beds...we had front rooms and they face the street/plaza making it very noisy at nite esp the weekend . breakfast was fair..croissants, toast and small danish and some canned fruit cocktail...and juice and coffee of course. there are many hostals in madrid and this seemed like the best..very hotel-ish, small lobby, front desk manned 24/7..one thing is no hairdryer...paid for 2 rooms about..price paid for 2 double rooms was total of 150 euros each nite so can't complain...

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: geogro
Reviews.Content: In August of 2009, my friend and I stayed at this hostal situated in the center of Madrid. It is very clean and has the basics. The breakfast is ok. There is no luxury but it is perfect for the price and location. The staff is very professional.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, excellent location, and cleanliness of hotel great.”
Reviews.Author: maureen46scotland
Reviews.Content: I Picked this Hostal after reading the reviews of other travellers. Last minute.com had a 4 star top of list, and it was cheaper, but the reviews were not good and the location seemed to be nothing as good as this one. We enjoyed our stay, the staff were brilliant and the location excellent. The rooms were basic, but we had a nice bathroom and our toileteries were replaced when we used them. The room was spotless, as was the rest of the hostal. We had breakfast once, and it was the usual continental breakfast, but if that was all you wanted it was fine, and you could have as many drinks as you wanted, which could be expensive elsewhere. We ate in the adjoining restaurant twice, and it was very reasonable and very nicely done up. If we were coming to Madrid again, we would definetely come back to Hostal Persal.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: dxiao2003
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about booking this place, because the rates we got were so amazing: 2 rooms (1 single 1 double) for 96 euros / night. But after browsing through some of the reviews here I decided to go ahead with it. It turned out really well, the rooms are decent size, not luxurious but definitely enough for 1 or 2 people, and they are very clean. We got rooms facing the interior so there was no problem with noise from outside. The walls are a little thin so you might hear your neighbors, though. The location is amazing, right in the middle of El Centro within walking distance of Sol, Huertas, the Prado and Reina Sofia museums, and the palace. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: suguisugui
Reviews.Content: I was there for three days with some colleagues and is very convenient for visiting Madrid without the hassle of a car. Room small, but staff friendly. Breakfast, standard for a hostal.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, very basic traditional 2 star”
Reviews.Author: AggiUggi
Reviews.Content: great location, very central, clean, safe. the room was tiny, yes, and the bathroom even tinier, but really, for the price, i had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible room and service”
Reviews.Author: PFS77
Reviews.Content: I had asked for a non-smoking room but the room they gave me had a very strong smell of smoking. I asked to change the room and they first said they did not have any other room. But there were some rooms that were still empty, with the gests expected to arrive later. But they simply didn't want to allow me to change room, probably because my reservation at Expedia had a penalty that I would have to pay the night anyway if I canceled it with less than 24h advance, which obviously was the case. After much discussion, they finally gave me a different room, which did not have a strong smell but was extremely small, with a small bed and almost no space to put the luggage. The window was very small and going to a tiny ventilation space. The room was much worse than the previous one but they said it was a normal room, and I had nothing to complain...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PR_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It is ideally located to restaurants and all the local attractions. We were able to walk or take public transportation to everything. The rooms were a little small but it was nice and clean. The breakfast is typical for these types of hotels; bread, ham, cheese, pastries, cereal, coffee and juice. The staff was pleasant and was happy to help us with anything that we needed. We were able to get wireless WiFi in the room but they also had a computer in the lobby for guest use.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Petitdudu09
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Breakfast is OK, rooms are clean (though small), localisation is excellent (in a no-car area), people are helpful... I would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good, cheap, comfortably Madrid hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickySeeksNotPicky
Reviews.Content: This hotel, ideally located to take advantage of Madrid's nightlife and its cultural attractions, offers cheap, clean rooms with few frills. The breakfast is adequate. There is wifi but it only works in the lobby. A computer is available for guests to use. The bathroom in our room was tiny, but suitable. This is where you go if you want a cheap place to sleep, leave your stuff, and grab a bite to out (bread, cereal) for a full day exploring the city. This is not where you go to relax or be pampered. Ideal for people on a budget, but who have some standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne_Stavanger
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at Hostal Persal when I was spending my Easter holidays in Madrid. After reading the reviews here, I was a bit afraid about what I shall find. But I was very satisfied with the hotel. After I had booked online and got confirmation, I emailed the hotel to ask for a room on the 4th floor with balcony. I didn't want to spend a whole week looking inside a courtyard. They provided me exactly with the type of room I wished. This is a two star hotel and therefore I was not expecting anything fancy. It was clean (bed and bathroom), although I admit that the floor in the room could have been swept a couple of more times during my stay. I had booked a double room (I was on my own) so space was not an issue for me. The room had a newish wooden floor, and the walls were in good shape, maybe they had been refreshed not too long ago. No (old) cigarette smell which is important for me. The beds were fine for me (I am not especially tall neither oversized). The walls might be a bit thin, but this considered, I found the hotel quiet (no slamming doors at odd hours, no loud people coming and going, etc). The balcony door had a double glass, so I was not either annoyed by the noise from Plaza del Angel, but of course it could get a bit animated. The breakfast did the trick for me, and it was always something to eat although I went 15 minutes before it was over. Free internet in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and all the younger people were speaking good English. Only one older man had troubles in English, but they were always two people at the desk, so I didn't have any problems to have my questions answered. The location of Hostal Persal is perfect. You have Cafe Central, Populart, Casa Patas around the corner. And the one cinema with the newest movie in original version is 3 blocks away. 10-15 minutes walk from Prado and Retiro. And many more sights and wonderful art museums within walking distance. I didn't use any metro or taxi during all my stay. The hotel has a very nice restaurant just besides it (Ginger), and I ended up having my dinners there, since they had a very nice choice of dishes (meat, fish, pasta, salads), good and fast service, and really decent prices. All in all I would recommend Hostel Persal for people who are easy going and who want something practical, nicely located and not a budget killer. If you are a bit peeky (nothing wrong about that), try a 4 or 5 stars instead :-)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: uoducks1999
Reviews.Content: I chose the Persal because it is located exactly where I wanted to be. The hotel is very close to Sol, Plaza Mayor and the Prado. I was very impressed with some of the restaurants around the hostal. The room was a bit small, but that was already expected. There was only 1 outlet in the room and 1 outlet in the bathroom. A flat panel tv on the wall which did allow for move space to move around. The walls were a little thin, I could hear the tv in the next room and I was not a fan of the pillow. The continental breakfast was pretty small and not a lot of options, but breakfast isn't as big there as it is here. The staff was amazing! Very nice and always helpful. One thing I thought was great idea is that you have to drop you key off at the front desk anytime to leave the hostal. That is a great idea since everyone I know mentioned the problems with pick pockets over there. I did not have any problems with pick pockets since my wallet had a chain that attached to my belt. The location was perfect to hit just about anything you wanted. Food, metro, plazas, shows and everything. I really enjoyed my time there and cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: trippy08uk
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a long weekend in Madrid with my daughter and son. We shared a triple room at the Hostal Persal and it was ideal for us. I booked the room via the website which shows photographs and videos of the hostal itself and the nearby Plaza Santa Ana. The location is superb, right in the centre of Madrid, with all of the main attractions within easy walking distance and plenty of places to eat, drink and just soak up the atmosphere. The room was what you would expect for a budget hotel - small and very basic but clean. The beds are small and narrow - which was ok for us because we are all under 5ft 4 inches, any taller and your feet will be hanging off the end of the bed. The en-suite bathroom was tiny but clean, there didn't seem to be a lack of hot water at any time, and a few basic toiletries were supplied (which I hadn't expected). The entrance is on the ground floor and reception is staffed 24/7. Many budget hotels/ hostals in the area are located on the upper floors of buildings, so you can't see the reception area before you enter and you have to ring a bell to be let in. The staff were friendly and very helpful - I don't know how well they speak English though, because I was able to speak Spanish with them. The buffet breakfast was excellent value - there was juice, tea, coffee, a choice of cereals, white and wholemeal bread rolls, ham, cheese, toast, a selection of jams, pastries and croissants. We weren't bothered by noise during our stay, but our room was overlooking the courtyard so I don't know if it would have been a different story had we been overlooking the street. There are cheaper hostals in the centre of Madrid, but I would definitely stay at the Hostal Persal again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy2109
Reviews.Content: I chose Hostal Persal mainly for its location, and its price. I had stayed for a period at a nicer hotel in the Plaza Santa Anna (Roommates Alicia), and wanted to be back in that great area, but not paying quite so much this time. Hostal Persal was a good option. It's central, but quiet. At the time of my stay they were working on some renovations, which they disclosed on their website, so the prices were a bit lower. The work only went on during the day, and thus was not a problem for me. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The place itself is nice, nothing fancy. The room was spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom. These are the two most important factors for me. The TV worked fine, though the only English channel was CNN (to be expected). I had a single room, which had a nice full-sized bed. The only negative was that the walls seemed quite thin. I could hear the Italian couple in the room next to me fighting... and I could also hear their TV at times (though again, this could have been them talking/fighting.. difficult to say!) Breakfast was adequate, not great, but enough. Nice that they serve it from 7 am all the way until 11:30, so if you're jetlagged and sleep in, you can still get something to eat. In any case, if you're starved for your usual muffin and enormous latte, you can find a Starbucks within 10 min. walk, just next to the Sevilla metro stop. I'd recommend Hostal Persal if you need a clean, budget hotel for a couple of nights in Madrid, and like to be able to walk to alot of the main sights. The Prado is about a 10 min. walk, and the train station about 10-15 min.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: Diego_W
Reviews.Content: Madrid was the last stop of a month trip to Europe in which we stayed in several 3 and 2 star hotels. This was by far the worst. As mentioned by other reviewers, the lobby has been renovated, but the problems start when you get to the room. The first one they gave us (in the first floor, backyard looking), had the most dirty and drain smelling bathroom I've ever encountered in a hotel. We asked to be changed immediately, and after a few hours we were shown two other rooms in the second floor which were only a little better but we decided to stay in one of them not to lose our first day in Madrid. All these room apparently shared the same characteristics: - Shabby looking and so small you could hardly pass between the bed and the wall, - Paper thin walls, doors and window resulting in loud noise coming from other rooms, hallway and backyard (shared with other buildings) - Drain smell and soiled tiles and bathtub in the bathroom which looked like it had not been cleaned thoroughly in a long time. Later we learnt from other guests that those who come with the Internet/Expedia rate are given the "backyard" rooms while those who pay the higher frontdesk rate get the renovated front rooms. When we ask if we could be moved to those rooms (even paying some upgrading fee), they told us that the hotel was full. Yes, the breakfast is eatable and the location is good but with such an efficient transport system as Madrid has I would have traded that for a better room, and I would recommend anyone to do so.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: european31
Reviews.Content: Having read the below reviews before I went I was not to sure about my booking. However, we had a double room on the fourth floor facing Plaza del Angel which was way above average, refurbished last year with solid double glazed balcony door, modern shower-room and wood flooring this room was a total surprise. No noise from neigbouring rooms unless you count in coughing at 07:00 when everything is quiet. Yes, the area is busy and noisy, that's why you stay in the center, but the double glazing cuts it all out. Room was spacy and clean. Staff all spoke english and were friendly. Breakfast is simple but good. Excellent choice. If their price structure stays this way we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A cold but exciting Madrid”
Reviews.Author: JanePowys
Reviews.Content: Hostal is in a great position, could walk everywhere in the city although did the Madrid Vision tourist bus one day. The reception area and breakfast room were quite plush and breakfast was excellent. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. However, our room two floors up was very small but clean and overlooked a courtyard area. Could have done with a picture or poster on the wall to brighten the room up. No problem with noise as our room was at the rear. Central cafe (Jazz) two doors away was a great place to spend the evening and the restaurant Ginger two doors the other way was very good value - it got very busy later so wise to book. Would really recommend it. Several very good restaurants in the next square, Plaza Santa Ana, too. Even if you don't use the train do visit the Atocha station - amazing place with lots of tropical plants and terrapins! Take your lunch if its a cold day, as we did, and sit in the warmth and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: VastVoodoo
Reviews.Content: Booked a short stay here in March, and would never do so again. The lobby is actually very nice looking, but once you get above the second floor you can tell where they stopped with the updates. The rooms are pathetically small (maybe 7 feet wide and I'm not even exaggerating) and the bed in the room I stayed in wasn't even close to being level. However, the absolute worst part was the PAPER THIN WALLS. You can hear everything that happens in the hallway and any rooms adjacent to yours, no matter how quiet the noise is. I could hear entire conversations even when they were spoken in a normal volume. And if the people next door decide to come back drunk at 2AM, you can just forget about sleep for the rest of the night. All of this would not have been so horrible if it wasn't for the price; I've stayed in much nicer youth hostels for about a quarter of what this place costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Persal”
Reviews.Author: lindaewan
Reviews.Content: Hostal Persal was a great place to stay! It had a great location and was close to the "Metro"(subway) which I used extensively. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The place was very clean and neat. My room was basic and comfortable. Extra pillows and blankets were brought to me on my request. Try it out, the price is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot!”
Reviews.Author: FearfulFlyer
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel. Despite (perhaps because?) of it being January, the room was boiling and I could find no way of reducing the temperature. The heating wasn't on as far as I could tell (the radiator was cold) and the air con didn't seem to work. I put the heat down to it's location at the centre of a labyrinthine web of corridors. The room itself was small and quiet bare, but it was clean and had an en suite bathroom (though very small). Basic toiletries were provided and the shower etc. worked. There was also a large TV with numerous channels including some in English. Reception staff were pleasant. I had breakfast at the hotel, it was pretty basic, consisting mainly of a variety of different kinds of bread, and I wasn't particularly impressed with it or the dining room. Location was quite good, being in between the Prado and the Puerto del Sol, and was within easy walking distance of all the main sites and the train station. It was quite noisy at night - all night - and this was a weekday. However, I believe this is a problem common to most Madrid hotels. I suppose for the price it wasn't bad, for saying it's near the centre of a capital city, but compared to other hotels I stayed in elsewhere in the region it was considerably less good value for money. However, I would stay there again, though probably not in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Persal - good location but so noisy.”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel013
Reviews.Content: This is my first review but I felt compelled to write this. I just returned from Spain and I stayed 2 nights in Madrid at the Hostal Persal at the start of my trip. The location is great - right off the Plaza Mayor and the staff are friendly. However, it was so noisy there that I did not get any sleep either nights. The noise came from two sources: the staff shouted at each other in the lobby area into the early morning (I was on an upper floor but the noise carried up the stairwell.). I assumed they were cleaning because of the banging. The second source was the other apartments with whom the Hostal shares a courtyard. There was remodeling and drilling noise from the apartments ALL NIGHT for both nights (in addition to shouting, talking, etc.). The breakfast was quite meager - a few pastries and toast. I stayed at another hotel at the same star-level for 1 night on my departure from Spain and it was a much better value, better location, FANTASTIC breakfast, and it was quiet. If you plan on staying up all night and not eating the breakfast, this is a fine place to stay because of location - otherwise, shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room”
Reviews.Author: curlytom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a few days at this hotel in September. The reception area was fine and check in was efficient but not very friendly. I had asked for a quiet room and we were shown to a room at the end of a corridor which looked out on to the back of the building. The room was tiny and the furniture was very basic. The bathroom was so small and overcrowded (they had crammed in a bidet) that it was not possible for a man to stand in front of the WV. The air conditioning unit looked lethal as it was so old and did not have a proper switch. The room reminded me of a cell and I initially felt I could not possibly spend 4 nights there. However, it was indeed quiet and we stayed where we were. The breakfast room/bar had obviously been refurbished recently and breakfast was good and the staff were very efficient. We arrived in Madrid by train to Atocha Station and had trouble finding a taxi to take us to the Hostal Persal. The first 2 drivers refused and they claimed not to know where it was, even though it was in the centre of the city. I think the journey was too short for them.

Reviews.Title: “A winner”
Reviews.Author: Bill1208
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. The rooms are comfortable, clean, and relatively spacious, and the price is reasonable. The staff is very friendly, efficient, and willing to help. The location is within walking distance of the Prado, other museums, and the train station. There are lots of restaurants in the area. The breakfast was included in our charge and had really good croissants. There is a computer available to guests for a nominal fee. Fine place to stay! It was a holiday weekend and some of the other guests were very noisy in the halls, but that wasn't the hotels fault. Note: a "hostal" in Spain seems to be just a hotel that shares its building with another tenant.

Reviews.Title: “The Ronseal of hotels.....”
Reviews.Author: GazzaWiltshire_UK_
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews below we booked this hotel for 2 nights in Madrid to kick of 2 weeks of touring across Spain & Italy. We got what must be one of the smaller, older rooms at the back of the hotel on the 2nd floor. It was very,very basic but clean and adequate and had a/c albeit very noisy. Breakfast was good and the location is central (considering one of Madrid's most fashionable hotels is nearly opposite) but 5-10 mins walk from any metro stop. Staff friendly & helpful, also drinks served outside the Hostal in the sun!! The next Plaza along, de Santa Ana, is very busy and can get good drinks and snacks and watch the world go by.....Paid an average of 80 EUR per night and wouldn't of wanted to have paid much more after staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking location for the money”
Reviews.Author: poshbirdShropshire
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from a girlie weekend in Madrid, the Hostal Persal was an ideal base for a visit to this city. For the money we paid it was excellent value. We had a room for four, it was small but as we spent little time there it wasn't a problem. Location wise it was ideal, no need to buy metro tickets or use taxis. Everywhere we wanted to see was within walking distance. It wasn't the Ritz but I would use this Hostal again if I was travelling with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, uncomfortable and noisy”
Reviews.Author: murakami
Reviews.Content: Two nights at this place was terrible. I paid 79 Euro for a small, uncomfortable and noisy room (outside beside the window a aircondition awake me during the whole night, and there even was a sight but just a shaft) Think it must be the same feeling as being in prison ! But the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Persal”
Reviews.Author: Smithla6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-night stay at the Hostal Persal. When we first walked in, we thought we were in the wrong place - the lobby and exterior looked really fancy and way too nice for what I was expecting! The person at the front desk took our bags (we arrived very early) and even brought them to our room for us! When we returned however and saw our room, it was much more what we expected. The room was pleasant enough, pretty much what you'd expect for the cost. The bed was comfortable and the room was relatively spacious compared to other hostals we've stayed in. Also, the location was great. We were really pleased that we were able to walk virtually everywhere - we bought two 10-ride metro tickets and ended up giving them away at the airport because we didn't need them. The hotel did have its problems, however. Our room was in a construction zone and had plastic sheeting hanging all around our hall outside the room. We returned to our room one afternoon for a short siesta, but couldn't sleep due to the loud hammering outside our room (in their defense, however, we never had a problem with the hammering at night.) We had a small TV that didn't work (luckily, we didn't want to watch it, but if we had, we would have been dissapointed.) The toliet ran the whole time we were there, which wasn't bad for us so much as it is bad for the environment. Finally, the shower was the tiniest thing I've ever been in - I couldn't reach for my shampoo without accidentally hitting the knob and blasting myself with cold water. The staff was friendly, although constantly rotating (we never seemed to see the same person twice.) Also, our room was cleaned daily. The free breakfast was great - toast with ham & cheese, croissants, rolls, pastries, cereal and fruit cocktail. It is served buffet style so you can have all you want. This was great and saved us a lot of money on breakfasts. The bad things about this hotel were the construction, the broken things in our room and ESPECIALLY the tiny shower. The good things were the breakfast and the great location. This probably wouldn't be the first place I'd want to stay if I went to Madrid again, but since we were rarely in the room anyway, it was not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay - Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: RedVickie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Persal between 21st March to the 24th. There were 14 of us in total. We were on a mini break to practice our Spanish .The staff at the Hostal were extremely Friendly and the whole hostal was very clean. The rooms were both clean and comfortable. Included in the price was a continental breakfast - but it was more than that. there was a large choice of cereals, pastries and breads, not to mention the 7 different jams. i would recommend this Hostal to anyone wanting to be in the heart of the City. close to all the atractions and who is on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sammysunshine
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 days in Madrid at the Hostal Persal. I honestly expected a bit more for over £300 for 3 nights. The rooms were very basic with no natural light but clean with lots of nice towels and serviced every day. The breakfast was a huge plus point. The staff were very friendly and helpful and brilliant with my 3 year old. The location was good. On the saturday night the Hostal was full of a school party and the noise all night long was a pain but not really the Hostals fault. We couldn't hear the guests next door but we could hear the guests in the next corridor. I would recommend it if you want a central location, breakfast and aren't intending on spending too much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: StudyAbroad07
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a hostal - we refuse to stay in hostels - but a recently renovated hotel! The lobby and breakfast area are actually american-standards, much better than basic. This is a true gem. The staff are friendly and helpful, and most speak English or try to help and understand you. The rooms are not huge, and just overlook a courtyard of other rooms - no view. But the rooms were cleanest we encountered on our European tour so far - and we have VERY high standards. The only complaint was the showerhead not staying placed - just an annoyance, not a major problem. TV in the room - we got CNN and VHI in english, not that you need to watch tv while in Madrid. Travel size of some toiletries are provided, no hairdryer though. Linens/towels not refreshed during our 2 night stay. Breakfast was surprisingly good - breads, cereals, juices and coffee/tea/cocoa. GREAT location. Sol is one main plaza in Madrid; Plaza Mayor is the other. This hotel is one block down from Sol where the Metro stop is, and just a few blocks from Mayor. Entire city is walkable - we only took the metro from the train station with our bags, and even then it was only 4 stops. Definitely the place to stay if you're on a budget in Madrid, but want something more live-able than your typical European hotel. Pleasant Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside, not so good inside”
Reviews.Author: GingerSD
Reviews.Content: I booked this on the internet, the hostal looks really good like a small hotel, excellent location. I was really disapointed about my room, I was small, it was almost impossible to get inside the bathroom and close the door. The rest of our group stayed at the Hostal Bianco II, (2 blocks away), they paid half of what I paid. The outside of their hostal looked bad, but I was surprise when I looked at the rooms. They where bigger, the bathroom clean and roomy (compared to mine) I am not into writing reviews, but I hope this review helps someone. The hostal persal was good, but for the money value, I would recomend the Bianco II. EVA

Reviews.Title: “Great for a break!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterErni
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed 5 days in the Hostal Persil over the 2007 new year celebration. The rooms whilst basic were comfortable and very clean. All the staff were very freindly including the cleaning staff. The continental breakfast was good and available up to 11:00 am ish. Location was superb only 5 mins walk from Sol but very quite even on new years eve! All in all a very good hostal in a prime location. Well worth considering if your on a budget!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Simple, Location”
Reviews.Author: chalmro1
Reviews.Content: 4.5 stars for this stay. We are a family with 2 daughters, age 17 and 14 years on a 10 day trip in Spain. We had 2 large, adjoined rooms with one bath that were clean, with a double and single in each room. The rooms had excellent soundproofing to the street and the hotel was quiet. The breakfast was plain but good, and the service at the desk was fine. All in all, this hotel is in a perfect location and offers excellent value for families travelling with teens. <highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Persal - Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: hgeep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hostal Persal in Madrid the weekend before Thanksgiving. While the room was somewhat "spartan", it was actually fairly roomy (i.e. room for our suitcases) by European standards. The room was clean and the beds were firm. The breakfast was not much . . .coffee and cereal and juice . .no meats. The best thing about this hotel was the location, in the Plaza Angel, within walking distance of the Puerta Del Sol and the Prado and other museums.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: violet125
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip. We stayed for 1 night. We stayed on the 4th floor. This is the newly renovated floor that is why the elevator does not come up to the 4th floor. It stops on the 3rd floor. A staff member did bring us to our room (it's a good thing or we would have gotten loss). The room was newly renovated so it was very nice and clean. We liked it very much. The halls were noisy with the doors slamming of other rooms. There is a sign on the door to be considerate of other guests when closing the door. The breakfast was good too. We would stay at this hostal again. The location was very good. It was very close to 'Casa Patas', if you wish to catch a flamenco show. This is a restaurant too, food was good and tourist friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lipgloss32
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to stay in on a short break to Madrid. After looking at a lot of other options I decided on this one mainly due to the reasonable price of 65 euros a night including breakfast. I was not expecting much but was pleasantly suprised. The hotel is a short walk from the Sol metro station and is easy to get to. The room and bathroom were extremely clean. Having breakfast included was a bonus and was satisfying as well as saving ourselves from having to find some where in the morning to eat. I would definately recommend this hotel, the staff were friendly, the location really central and overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again, despite location!”
Reviews.Author: mwieler
Reviews.Content: Booked a "Double Room Large Bed" through Travelocity, in part, because it stated their deposit policy as "NO DEPOSIT REQUIRED, - IF INTERESTED ADVANCED PAYMENT PLEASE SEND A SIGNED FAX AUTHORISING THE CHARGE INTO A CREDIT CARD NUMBER." (Had lots of Euros from a previous trip that I wanted to use!) When I arrived I was told that my credit card, used as a guarantee only, had been charged the moment I booked the room. Despite asking that they reverse it and showing them the paper confirming my reservation with the above explicitly stated, they refused. I was then given a room with 2 beds, not "Double Room Large Bed" and was told with the price I was paying that was what they could give me. I was too tired to argue! I clarified TWICE that breakfast, such as it was, was included in the price and was assured, by 2 different people at the front desk, that it was. Imagine my surprise with being presented with a 25 Euro bill at check out for breakfast! The person at the front desk argued vehemently that I owed them the money for the "lovely breakfasts" I had enjoyed, telling me that I had been given wrong information at check in. I left without paying it and have called my credit card to deny the charge if they tried to put it through. Not a pleasant experience! Having said that, it is clean and the location was good -close to Metro and restaurants. The rooms are not very sound-proof and I was awoken 3 times at 2am by people getting off the elevator and talking loudly as they passed my room. Madrid is great but you could do better with a hotel than this one!

Reviews.Title: “Exellenent little pesion”
Reviews.Author: Heidi1942
Reviews.Content: The little Hostel can not be beat for its cleanliness, the helpfull staff and the location. We were on a limited budget and could not have done any better. There was a comment that said the elevator only goes to the third floor, from what we could tell the fouth floor was not rented. Unless you budget is much larger the hotel is fine for young and old alike. Heidi Black

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, staff and price/quality”
Reviews.Author: mluz
Reviews.Content: I will definetely stay in Hostal Persal in my next visit to Madrid. It is a simple but fantastic hotel, where everything interesting in Madrid is nearby; in the same block: Cafe Central (superb live jazz), España Cañí bar (beers and long drinks); you can have typical "churros" (churrería in front of Calderon Theatre), tapas in Plaza Santa Ana is a must (just a block from Persal)... Staff is excellent. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Persal is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are small, but clean--the price is unbeatable, the location is excellent (a few blocks south of Puerta del Sol) and the staff friendly. Ask for a room facing the courtyard--they are really quiet. Don't expect air conditioning, though. What passes for "A/C" merely blows hot air around. But it's cool enough at night that the rooms aren't too uncomfortable. Unbeatable for the price, and perfect for our budget as newlyweds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good value”
Reviews.Author: Dugg
Reviews.Content: Had a small room but the location was great. Price was good. The staff was friendly, fluent, and helpful. Had one of the better breakfast setups and that was included so the value was great.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJ_and_PC
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Madrid we stayed at the Parsal. Its best feature is its location - It is less than 5 minutes to both the Placa Mayor and the Puerta de Sol. The hotel is clean, the rooms are simple and fairly small. The inclusive buffet breakfast consisted of cold meats, cheese, cereal, yoghurt etc. The reception staff were English speakers, all staff were friendly and helpful. From what we could see of hotels with similar star rating the Persal seemed a good choice. If you are loong for grand comfort this is not the hotel for you but we would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “good and bad”
Reviews.Author: kmiami
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Madrid on 9th March 2005, where we stayed the first three nights at the HOSTAL BIANCO II and two nights at the HOSTAL PERSAL, both nearby the PUERTO DEL SOL area. HOSTAL BIANCO - the building entrance was under construction and quite unappealing. The rooms were very noisy (we had asked for a quiet room) the walls were paper thin, which was surprising since we chose older buildings for the ambiance. The staff was nice and helpful and although quite thin the linens were clean. WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN EVEN THOUGH THE LOCATION WAS GREAT. We left town for a couple of days and then returned to Madrid to a different hotel, again looking for ambiance. So we chose the HOSTAL PERSAL which touted an underground lounge. The common areas (lobby/entrance, etc.) were appealing but the rooms are still in need of upgrading (the doors are very flimsy) and the bathrooms are quite worn looking. Also the floors had several areas that were soft, as though it could actually fall in. The most disappointing thing about this hotel was that the initial reviews and photos showed the downstairs bar/lounge area in use and were lead to believe that this underground room would be open for either bar drinks or breakfast, which was the reason for choosing this hotel. Regretfully, this room was closed off to the public. The location however, was ideal, although at the time of our visit the Plaza in front of the hotel was under construction, which was not the fault of the hotel. Guess we would stay at HOSTAL PERSAL again if the floors/doors and bathrooms in the rooms were upgraded.
